<h3 class="">
<a href="/news/local_news/concord-teacher-to-be-honored/article_b409a77c-0b27-5b84-845d-deca4f011ccf.html">
        

        
        Concord teacher to be honored</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>A Concord West Side Elementary School teacher will be recognized Saturday during halftime of the Big Ten Football Championship in Indianapolis for a project she and her students developed to help reduce waste and improve efficiency within the schools drinking water system.</p>

<div class="card-body">

<h3 class="">

        MEN'S BASKETBALL: No. 3 Michigan State beats No. 5 Notre Dame</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>EAST LANSING, Mich.  Joshua Langford scored 12 of his 17 points in the first half to help No. 3 Michigan State take a huge lead it was able to restore in the second half against No. 5 Notre Dame in an 81-63 victory Thursday night. </p>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Tuesday morning, Goshen water crews shut down the water main on Huron Street to replace a broken fire hydrant.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The Indiana Department of Environmental Management requires the Water Utility to issue a boil water order for the affected area, which is Huron Street from West Lincoln to Pike Street.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":"cnhi\/goshennews","size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/goshennews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">After replacement of the fire hydrant, two consecutive water samples will be taken and analyzed for the presence of bacteria. If two consecutive tests pass, the boil order will be lifted.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Notice of the boil order cancellation will be distributed via a customer flier and a notice will be posted in The Goshen News. For further information or to report specific service concerns, call Mindy Kyle at the Goshen Water Department at 534-5306.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":"cnhi\/goshennews","size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/goshennews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block visible-xs" id="tncms-block-1150602">
<!-- Mobile Rectangle ATF 300x250 article -->
<div class="visible-xs visible-sm" id="mobileRectangle_atf" style="width:100%;text-align:center">
<script type="text/javascript">
AdBridg.cmd.push(function() { AdBridg.display('mobileRectangle_atf'); });
</script>
</div>
<div class="clear" style="padding-bottom:10px"></div>
</div></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">City water within the affected area should not be consumed without first following prescribed boiling procedures. The water remains safe for bathing, laundry, and restroom facilities. Cleaning dishes with a dishwasher is acceptable if it has a sanitizing cycle. Hand-washed dishes should be rinse with boiled or bottled water.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

in Oak Bluffs.  Photo by Nate Horwitz" href="http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign.jpg"><img alt="" class="entry-thumb td-modal-image" height="409" sizes="(max-width: 696px) 100vw, 696px" src="http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign-696x409.jpg" srcset="http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign-696x409.jpg 696w, http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign-300x176.jpg 300w, http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign-768x452.jpg 768w, http://www.mvtimes.com:80/mvt/uploads/2014/07/Inkwell-beach-closed-sign.jpg 794w" title="Inkwell beach closed sign" width="696"/></a><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">High bacteria counts led to the closure Tuesday of Ink Well beach in Oak Bluffs.  Photo by Nate Horwitz</figcaption></figure></div><div class="mailmunch-forms-before-post" style="display: none !important;"></div><p>Oak Bluffs health officials closed Inkwell Beach and Pay Beach on Tuesday after water tests Monday showed higher than acceptable levels of bacteria. The two beaches along Sea View Avenue are among the most popular swimming spots in Oak Bluffs at the height of the summer season.</p><div class="mvt-dfp-right" id="div-gpt-ad-1485712576291-3"> <script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1485712576291-3'); });</script> </div><p>Water samples taken from Inkwell Beach on Monday showed levels of enterococci bacteria more than four times higher than state regulations allow. Samples taken on Pay Beach showed bacteria levels more than five times the allowable limit. Enterococci is an indicator bacteria. While not usually harmful, it indicates the presence of other harmful bacteria in the water.</p><p>Health agent Shirley Fauteaux said she will test the water again on Wednesday. Results will not be returned until a day later, so the two beaches will remain closed until at least Thursday.</p><p>Madeiras Beach near Sailing Camp Park in Lagoon Pond, and Marinelli Beach, adjacent to the East Chop Beach Club are again open to swimmers. Both were closed in recent weeks because of high bacteria counts.</p><div class="mailmunch-forms-in-post-middle" style="display: none !important;"></div><div class="mvt-dfp-left" id="div-gpt-ad-1485712576291-4"> <script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1485712576291-4'); });</script> </div><p>The Massachusetts Bureau of Environmental Health advises that swimming in polluted water can cause gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain, respiratory symptoms such as sore throat, cough, runny nose, and sneezing, eye and ear symptoms including irritation, earache, and itchiness, dermatological symptoms like skin rash and itching, and flu-like symptoms such as fever and chills.</p><p>Most of these symptoms are minor most of the time, but they can occasionally be more serious, especially in sensitive populations such as those with weakened immune systems, children, and the elderly.</p><div class="mailmunch-forms-after-post" style="display: none !important;"></div><div class="clearfix"></div><div class="mvt-brick" id="div-gpt-ad-1485712576291-1"> <script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { Cedarville Residents Asked To Boil Water

Tuesday
Jul22,2014at1:20AM Jul22,2014at10:35AM

The Arkansas Department of Health has issued a boil water notice for 70 customers of the Cedarville Waterworks.

The Arkansas Department of Health has issued a boil water notice for 70 customers of the Cedarville Waterworks.


Customers affected are on Peaceful Home Road and its side roads in Natural Dam, according to a news release.


The order was issued because of a water main break.


Under the order, all affected customers are advised the water may be unsafe for human use, the release states. Users should briskly boil all water for drinking and food preparation for one minute prior to use. Ice cubes should be discarded and only boiled water used for making ice.


The order will remain in effect until the problem has been corrected and bacterial tests show the water is safe to drink, the release states.

<meta content="NATURAL DAM (KFSM) - A boil order is now in effect for people who live and work in Natural Dam, according to Cedarville Water Department Superintendent Fred Snipes.

The boil order affects people whose homes and businesses are on Peaceful Home Road and in surrounding areas in that community.

Authorities said 20-feet of the water line broke earlier Tuesday morning (July 22)." property="og:description"/>

<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=800&h=450&crop=1 800w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=768&h=432&crop=1 768w" width="400"/> </a>

<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">

<h4 class="title">Boil Order Issued in CrawfordCounty</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="511" sizes="(max-width: 770px) 100vw, 770px" src="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=770" srcset="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=770 770w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=1540 1540w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300 300w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/water.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=1024 1024w" width="770"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>NATURAL DAM (KFSM)  A boil order is now in effect for people who live and work in Natural Dam, according to Cedarville Water Department Superintendent Fred Snipes.</p>
<p>The boil order affects people whose homes and businesses are on Peaceful Home Road and in surrounding areas in that community.</p>
<p>Authorities said 20-feet of the water line broke earlier Tuesday morning (July 22).</p>
<p>Crews are out now, working to repair the line. Once the necessary repairs are made, officials said theyll send samples of the water to the Arkansas Health Department to make sure it is safe to drink and use.</p>
<p>The precautionary boil order is in effect until further notice.</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
</div>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<base href="http://www.newstrib.com/content/tncms/live/"/>
<meta content="rockwell, boil, road, location, order, john s. duncan, water main" name="keywords"/>
<meta content="rockwell, boil, road, location, order, john s. duncan, water main" name="news_keywords"/>

var pbjs = pbjs || {};
    pbjs.que = pbjs.que || [];
    
    googletag.cmd.push(function() {
        // Disable requests for ads on page load
        googletag.pubads().disableInitialLoad();
    });
    
    pbjs.que.push(function() {
        pbjs.addAdUnits(adUnits);
        
        // Declare bidder aliases
        
        
        // Send bid request
        pbjs.requestBids({
            bidsBackHandler: sendAdserverRequest
        });
        
        // Bidder settings
        pbjs.bidderSettings = {
            standard: {
                adserverTargeting: [
                    {
                        key: "hp_pb",
                        val: function(bidResponse) {
                            return bidResponse.pbMg;
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        key: "hb_bidder",
                        val: function(bidResponse) {
                            return bidResponse.bidderCode;
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        key: "hb_adid",
                        val: function(bidResponse) {
                            return bidResponse.adId;
                        }
                    }
                ]
            }
        };
        
    });
    
    // GPT ad request when all bids are back, or when timeout is hit, whichever comes earlier
    function sendAdserverRequest() {
        if (pbjs.adserverRequestSent) {
            return; // Ensure sendAdserverRequest only called once
        }
        pbjs.adserverRequestSent = true;
        googletag.cmd.push(function() {
            pbjs.que.push(function() {
                pbjs.setTargetingForGPTAsync(); // Attach all bids to ad units before fetching ads
                googletag.pubads().refresh();  // Trigger GPT to send out the ad request for all ad units on page
            });
        });
    }
    
    // Log all bids
    function pbjs_logAllBids() {
        var responses = pbjs.getBidResponses();
        var output = [];
        for (var adunit in responses) {
            if (responses.hasOwnProperty(adunit)) {
                var bids = responses[adunit].bids;
                for (var i = 0; i < bids.length; i++) {
                    var b = bids[i];
                    output.push({
                        'adunit': adunit, 'adId': b.adId, 'bidder': b.bidder,
                        'time': b.timeToRespond, 'cpm': b.cpm, 'msg': b.statusMessage
                    });
                }
            }
        }
        if (output.length) {
            if (console.table) {
                console.log('All bids returned');
                console.table(output);
            } else {
                for (var j = 0; j < output.length; j++) {
                    console.log(output[j]);
                }
            }
        } else {
            console.warn('NO prebid responses');
        }
    }
    
    // Log winning bids
    function pbjs_logWinningBids() {
        var bids = pbjs.getHighestCpmBids();
        var output = [];
        for (var i = 0; i < bids.length; i++) {
            var b = bids[i];
            output.push({
                'adunit': b.adUnitCode, 'adId': b.adId, 'bidder': b.bidder,
                'time': b.timeToRespond, 'cpm': b.cpm
            });
        }
        if (output.length) {
            if (console.table) {
                console.log('Winning bids');
                console.table(output);
            } else {
                for (var j = 0; j < output.length; j++) {
                    console.log(output[j]);
                }
            }
        } else {
            console.warn('No prebid winners');
        }
    }
    
    setTimeout(function() {

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            // Reset the meter if the data store is too old.
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking reset date");

    var expireDate = new Date(__tnt.metering.config.date);
    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

        __tnt.log(nextDate);
    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking whether user has read this before");
    
    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");
        __tnt.metering.config.read = true;
    }else{
        __tnt.log("not read before");
    }
});
// if count is less than registration limit return true
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if(__tnt.recent.count.get()<__tnt.metering.config.reg_limit){
        return true;
    }
});
// check if the user is known and then test against the subscription limit
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if((__tnt.user.loggedIn)&&(__tnt.recent.count.get()<__tnt.metering.config.sub_limit)){
        return true;
    }
});
// if the user has read this asset before they can read the asset
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("user has previously viewed asset");
        return true;
    }
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("executing granted scripts");
    // Analytics logging goes here
    if(window.ga){
        if(__tnt.metering.config.read){
            // log read
            __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'previously read','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
        }else{
            // log new view
            if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){
                __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'under subscription limit','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});

                if(window.sessionStorage){
                    if(sessionStorage.getItem('__tnt.metering.wall.registration')){
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'wall action','label':'logged in after encountering wall','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
                    }

                    sessionStorage.removeItem('__tnt.metering.wall.registration');
                }
            }else{
                __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'under registration limit','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
            }

        }
    }
});
// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    // this will also need to check if the user has previously read the asset (by checking the swtich set by the init script.)
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("incrementing counter");

        var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
        count++;
        __tnt.recent.count.set(count);

        // fire an event that will allow a one time only message for a given count
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.new');
    }else{
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.read');
    }
});
// add unread assets to the recent asset list
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.recent.assets.add(__tnt.metering.config.uuid);
    }
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){$('.subscriber-hide').show();
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;
    var remaining = (limit - count);

    if(count > limit){count = limit;}
    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}

    var messageClass = 'access';
    if(__tnt.metering.config.referred){ messageClass = 'referred'; }
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){ messageClass = 'read'; }

    var message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=false]').first();
    if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=true]').first(); }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+']').first(); }

        .after('<div class="subscription-required"></div>');
    
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;

    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}
    
    var messageClass = 'subscription';
    if((count>=__tnt.metering.config.reg_limit)&&(count<__tnt.metering.config.sub_limit)){

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{
        window.sessionStorage.setItem('__tnt.compatibility',true);
    }catch(e){
        compatible = false;
        status = "FAIL: setItem unsupported";
    };
    if(!compatible){
        __tnt.log(status);
    }
    return {'check':compatible,'status':status};
};
var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(1822);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(1969);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://www.newstrib.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<script>
    $(function(){
       var zipcodes = [];

       $.each($('.subscription-services .subscription-service.subscription-service-delivered'),function(){
           $(this).find('.service-sublink a.btn.btn-primary').on('click',function(){
               $('#zipcode-restriction').find('input[name=serviceid]').val($(this).attr('data-subscription-service'));
               zipcodes = $(this).attr('data-subscription-service-zipcodes').split(',');

               $('#template-metering').find('.metering-modal').modal('toggle');
               $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.modal').modal({});

               return false;
           });
       });


       $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.zipcode-restriction-modal').on('click',function(){
           $('#template-metering').find('.metering-modal').modal('toggle');
           $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.modal').modal({
               static:'static',
               keyboard:false
            });

            return false;
       });


       $('#zipcode-restriction').on('submit',function(){
           if($('#zipcode-restriction').find('[name=zipcode]').val()!=""){

               if($.inArray($('#zipcode-restriction').find('[name=zipcode]').val(), zipcodes) > -1){
                   console.log("form is valid, should submit");
               }else{
                   console.log("form is catching on zipcode check");

                   $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.zipcode-restriction-warning').removeClass('hidden').show();

                   return false;
               }
           } else {
               console.log("form is catching on zipcode blank check");
               return false;
           }
       });
    });
</script>
<script type="text/javascript">
    $(function(){
        var i = 0;
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services').find('.subscription-service').each(function(){
            $(this).attr('id','service-tab-'+i);
        
            $(this).find('.panel-heading h3').html('<a href="" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="services-modal-collapsable-tabs" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="service-tab-'+i+'">'+$(this).find('.panel-heading h3').text()+'</a>')
            $(this).find('.panel-body').addClass('panel-collapse collapse').attr('role','tabpanel');
            
            if(i==0){
                $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('show');
                $(this).find('.panel-footer').show();
            }else{
                $(this).find('.panel-footer').hide();
            }
        
            i++;
        });
    
        $('.subscription-services-filter').hide();
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').css({'padding':'0px'});
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').find('a').css({'display':'block','padding':'10px 15px'});
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').find('a[data-toggle=collapse]').on('click',function(event){
            var id = $(this).attr('aria-controls');
            var open = $('#'+id).find('.collapse').hasClass('in');
            
            $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service').each(function(){
                if(this.id == id){
                    $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('show');
                    $(this).find('.panel-footer').show();
                }else{
                    $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('hide');
                    $(this).find('.panel-footer').hide();
                }
            });
        });
        
        $('#asset-content').find('.subscription-required').find('.panel-footer').find('a[data-toggle=collapse]').on('click',function(event){
            $(this).parents('.panel-footer').find('.collapse.collapse-rates').collapse('toggle');
        });
        
        
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter-modal-open').on('click',function(){
            $('#asset-content').find('.alert.notification').css({'z-index':'900'});
            $("#template-metering").find('.metering-modal').first().modal();
        
        });
        
        $('#eedition-subscription').find('.meter-modal-open').on('click',function(){
            $("#template-metering").find('.metering-modal').first().modal();
        });
    });
    
</script>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Awater main break on Rockwell Road in La Salle at noon Sunday caused the city of La Salle to issuea boil order for one southeast-side neighborhood.</p></div>
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center ">

<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The order to boil water before drinking or using is in effect until samples are tested and cleared.</p></div>

<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The boil order will affect locations from Rockwell road from Interstate 39 to Industrial Drive. Affected homes have been tagged with notification, said John S. Duncan, city finance director.</p></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://www.newstrib.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=a8f10f31-3f37-5830-ae14-7f82b1aeb6ee&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = false;
            var sOriginID = 'a8f10f31-3f37-5830-ae14-7f82b1aeb6ee';
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://www.newstrib.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=a8f10f31-3f37-5830-ae14-7f82b1aeb6ee&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'a8f10f31-3f37-5830-ae14-7f82b1aeb6ee') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-next");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.newstrib.com/tncms/block/591174/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

    "headline": "Boil-water order issued in Orrick",
    "articleBody": "City leaders in Orrick announced Sunday that it has issued a boil-water order.Customers are advised to bring tap water to a rolling boil before drinking it or using it for cooking. Ice cubes recently made from tap water should also be discarded.In its announcement, the city did not say why the order has been issued.The announcement said it would be in effect until further notice.11833402",

<div class="article-content--body-text">
<strong class="dateline">ORRICK, Mo. </strong> <p>City leaders in Orrick announced Sunday that it has issued a boil-water order.</p><p>Customers are advised to bring tap water to a rolling boil before drinking it or using it for cooking. Ice cubes recently made from tap water should also be discarded.</p><div class="article-content--body-wrapper-side-floater ">
<!-- blocks/ad.twig -->
<div class="ad-rectangle ">
<div class="ad-container or-halfpage" data-loc="btf" data-type="rectangle"></div>
<div class="ad-label">Advertisement</div>
</div>
<!-- blocks/ad.twig -->
</div>
<p>In its announcement, the city did not say why the order has been issued.</p><p>The announcement said it would be in effect until further notice.</p><p></p><p><br/></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

Kingston lifts boil water order

Saturday
Jul19,2014at6:41PM Jul19,2014at6:42PM

Richard J. Bayne

KINGSTON A boil water advisory that was in effect Friday in Kingston was lifted Saturday, city officials announced.
The advisory was put in lace, city officials said, after a malfunction of a chlorine injector at the city's water plant had the system falling below the minimum levels for more than 4 hours. The chlorine feed was re-
Established and all system disinfectant residuals were at normal levels by Saturday morning. Samples were collected from throughout the system and all coliform tests performed on those samples were negative. The order was lifted after consultation with the Ulster County Health Department.

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/illinois/crystallake/politics">politics & government</a> <h1>
      McHenry Co. Beaches Closed Due to High Bacteria Levels    </h1>
<h2 class="h4"></h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/amie-schaenzer-2">Amie Rowland, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2014-07-18 12:02:20">Jul 18, 2014 12:02 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/23997815/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>

<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>
<div class="social-share-wrapper"><div class="social-share text-center"><a alt="Share on Facebook" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-facebook" href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A//patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864" target="_blank" title="Share on Facebook" trigger="facebook"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-facebook-f"></span></a><a alt="Tweet" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-twitter" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=McHenry%20Co.%20Beaches%20Closed%20Due%20to%20High%20Bacteria%20Levels&url=https%3A//patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864" target="_blank" title="Tweet" trigger="twitter"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-twitter"></span></a><a alt="Post on Google+" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-google-plus hidden-xxs" href="https://plus.google.com/share?url=https%3A//patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864&t=McHenry%20Co.%20Beaches%20Closed%20Due%20to%20High%20Bacteria%20Levels" target="_blank" title="Post on Google+" trigger="google_plus"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-google-plus-g"></span></a><a alt="Post on Reddit" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-reddit hidden-xxs" href="http://www.reddit.com/submit?url=https%3A//patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864&title=McHenry%20Co.%20Beaches%20Closed%20Due%20to%20High%20Bacteria%20Levels" target="_blank" title="Post on Reddit" trigger="reddit"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-reddit-alien"></span></a><a alt="Send Email" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-email hidden-xxs" href="mailto:?subject=McHenry Co. Beaches Closed Due to High Bacteria Levels&body=McHenry Co. Beaches Closed Due to High Bacteria Levels%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0Ahttps://patch.com/illinois/crystallake/mchenry-co-beaches-closed-due-to-high-bacteria-levels_f6ea9864" title="Send Email" trigger="email"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-envelope"></span></a><a class="btn-comment-now social-btn social-btn-comments" href="#comments" title="View Comments for McHenry Co. Beaches Closed Due to High Bacteria Levels"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-comments"></span><span class="disqus-comment-count p bold visible-lg-block visible-md-block visible-sm-block visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="23997815">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p><b><i>Submitted by the McHenry County Department of Health</i></b><br/></p><p>McHenry County Department of Health (MCDH) conducted beach water samplings at 37 licensed beaches on Thursday, July 17.</p><p>Wonder Center beach, located at 4100 E Lakeshore Drive inWonder Lake, is on ADVISORY while two other beaches are CLOSED due to elevated bacteria levels:<u></u><u></u></p><ul><li>Wonder Woods 4, 5200 Wonder Woods Drive (Wonder Lake)</li><li>Sunrise Ridge, 3800 W Lakeshore Drive (Wonder Lake)<u></u></li></ul><p><u></u></p><p><u></u></p><p>These beaches will be resampled on Friday, July 18. Residents should visit the MCDH webpage at<a href="http://www.mcdh.info/">www.mcdh.info</a>for the latest information on these beaches.<u></u><u></u></p><p>To prevent illness associated with swimming, all licensed beaches on the 12 lakes in McHenry County are tested every 2 weeks for E. coli throughout the summer to determine water quality. Additional and more frequent sampling is done when elevated bacterial levels are found.</p><p>Water sampling results are reported to the appropriate beach authorities. MCDH will post an advisory or closed signage for beaches with elevated E. coli results.</p><p>All beach water results and locations are readily available at the MCDH webpage<a href="http://www.mcdh.info/">www.mcdh.info</a>or by calling815-334-4585.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">Subscribe <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Framingham beach closed due to high E. coli counts

Friday
Jul18,2014at2:50PM Jul18,2014at3:27PM

Staff reports

FRAMINGHAM - Lake Waushakum on Nipmuc Terrace remains closed today over high e. coli counts, officials say.

Public Health Director Steven Ward said a sample of the public beach's water taken Monday revealed 1,600 colony forming units of the bacteria, nearly seven times the limit of 235.

A sample taken Wednesday showed the same levels of contamination, he said.

Ward said the town is awaiting results of a new sample, taken today, and will reopen the pond to swimmers if the bacteria levels have fallen to within the limit.

Until testing shows the water is safe, the beach is open only for activities such as sunbathing and picnicking, Recreation Superintendent Trisha Powell said.

Citywide boil order lifted

Friday
Jul18,2014at1:30PM

Testing showed no contamination in the water

Kewanee city officials announced Friday afternoon that a boil order issued the day before has been lifted.

Here is the news release from City Manager Kip Spear:

"The City of Kewanee water system boil water advisory issued July 17, 2014 is hereby cancelled effective immediately.

"Customers of the Kewanee Water system were notified on July 17 of a drop in pressure under 20 p.s.i. in the distribution system mid-morning on July 17 due to low water levels in the elevated storage tanks. Pressure has since been restored to the distribution system.

"Bacteriological testing conducted system-wide later in the day on July 17 showed no threat to public health from consumption of the water. Thus, the boil water advisory is cancelled.

"The Kewanee Water system apologizes for the inconvenience and thanks everyone for their patience while the testing was conducted to confirm the water was potable."

Beaches closed due to elevated bacteria levels

By NORTHWEST HERALD
July 18, 2014

Two McHenry County beaches have been closed due to elevated bacteria levels, according the McHenry County Department of Health.

While Wonder Center Beach, 4100 E. Lakeshore Dr., Wonder Lake, is on advisory, the following two beaches are closed:

Wonder Woods 4, 5200 Wonder Woods Dr., Wonder Lake

Sunrise Ridge, 3800 W. Lakeshore Dr., Wonder Lake

The McHenry County Department of Health on Thursday conducted beach water samplings at 37 licensed beaches a practice done every two weeks to check for E. coli.

When elevated bacteria levels are found, additional and more frequent sampling is done, the release states.

The beaches will be resampled Friday.

Results and locations are readily available at the McHenry County Department of Health webpage, www.mcdh.info, or by calling (815) 334-4585.

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5002);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4544);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5325);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4528);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4529);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4530);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5264);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://thesouthern.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
</div>
</div></div>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://thesouthern.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=31503de6-e5d2-5704-a47c-746e268ebcf0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://thesouthern.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=31503de6-e5d2-5704-a47c-746e268ebcf0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '31503de6-e5d2-5704-a47c-746e268ebcf0') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://thesouthern.com/tncms/block/1401217/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Kewanee under city-wide boil order

  • Jul 17, 2014
  • ()
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Print
  • Save

Press release submitted by City of Kewanee Public Works Department

Effective immediately 7/17/14 there is a city-wide boil order issued due to an unexpected problem with a city water tower Thursday morning.

All residents will be under a boil order for 48 72 hours for any water that will be consumed (water for drinking, cooking, etc.).

If you have any questions, please call City Hall at 852-2611.

The City of Kewanee Water system hereby issues a boil water advisory for all water users, city-wide.

The City of Kewanee Water system advises all water users to boil their drinking water. The boil water advisory is in effect until further notice.

What should I do?

DO NOT DRINK THE WATER WITHOUT BOILING IT FIRST. Bring all water to a boil, let it boil for 3-5 minutes, and let it cool before using, or use bottled water. Boiled or bottled water should be used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, washing dishes, and food preparation until further notice. Boiling kills bacteria and other organisms in the water.

What happened? What is being done?

The pressure in the water distribution system dropped below 20 p.s.i. for a period of time in mid-morning on July 17, due to low water levels in the elevated water storage tanks. Because of this decrease in distribution system pressure, this Drinking Water Alert is issued. The water levels in the tanks have since been restored to normal levels. Consequently, pressure in the water distribution system has returned to normal operating range.

All residents will be under a boil water advisory for 48 to 72 hours for any water used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, washing dishes, and food preparation. A notice of termination of the boil water advisory will be issued upon satisfactory test results being obtained.

Please share this information with all the other people who drink this water, especially those who may not have received this notice directly (for example, people in apartments, nursing homes, schools, and businesses). You can do this by posting this notice in a public place or distributing copies by hand or mail.

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>A main water distribution pipeline, serving several Central Texas communities including Fort Hood, broke Sunday creating a need for Stage 4 (Critical) Emergency Water Conservation on the installation and causing post senior leaders to tell all but emergency essential troops and employees to stay home Monday.</p><p>This interruption in the main water supply line that serves the post from the Bell County Water Control and Improvement District No. 1 meant consumption of water by all customers was limited to essential use only until the water supply interruption was corrected. Customers were highly encouraged to conserve water, using only for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene until situation was resolved.</p><p>Water conservation measures set in motion the prohibition of lawn irrigation, washing of vehicles, filling of swimming pools, and other nonessential indoor and outdoor uses. All Fort Hood outdoor pools closed late Sunday afternoon, sending patrons home, once the prohibition went into effect on the installation.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/forthoodsentinel.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>The quality of water has not been affected, a III Corps and Fort Hood Public Affairs release stated Sunday, just the quantity.</p><p>As a precautionary measure, however, American Water, the installations water supplier, instituted a Boil Water Notice order, which remained in effect until officials from American Water received confirmation from laboratory analysis that the water quality on the installation met drinking water standards. That confirmation was received Wednesday afternoon, ending the Boil Water Notice order.</p><p>This issue was not unique to Fort Hood, Tom Rheinlander, director of Public Affairs for U.S. Army Garrison  Fort Hood. We were just one of several communities affected by the interruption in water service.</p><p>While the water distribution pipeline was repaired late Sunday, low-water levels servicing the installation prompted senior leaders to cancel physical fitness training Monday and Tuesday, and have only emergency essential personnel report to work Monday.</p><p>Rheinlander said it was important for the installation to convey information to the installations military community, as well as Soldiers and their Families who live in surrounding affected communities, in light of the impacts of the water service interruption. He said the installation kept a steady flow of</p><p>information going out via area media outlets, the posts Internet-based press center and through its Facebook page, which had more than 170,000 views by Sunday evening.</p><p>Late Monday, installation leaders released information about what Fort Hood area housing residents could expect once water delivery resumed to the installation as the distribution lines were systematically recharged.</p><p>Water service will be restored incrementally across the installation, the release Monday afternoon stated. Some areas may experience low-water pressure, or not have water service, until late today  or (the) morning of July 15.</p><p>The release reiterated the need for patrons to continue to boil water until water sampling could be conducted by the water utility provider in accordance with Texas Commission on Environmental Quality.</p><p>In addition, Mondays release explained what may be observed by patrons as water utility crews flushed the system, which is part of bringing the system back online, a routine operation of the utility system.</p><p>Some customers may see discolored water (yellow and/or brown) as the system is being re-charged, the release stated. This will clear up as the water is being used and the system is flushed. If residents have discolored water, they should run an outside faucet for 10 minutes and check again. If the problem persists, call the Directorate of Public Works service desk at 287-2113. Use caution before doing laundry if you have discolored water.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/forthoodsentinel.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><p>Some customers may see milky colored water or have spurts of air coming out of the faucet. This is due to air in the water mains and will clear up with use and flushing of the system, the release continued. Customers who have restricted flow or low flows out of individual faucets after July 16 should follow their normal service request procedure.</p><p>The reaction by community members to losing a day of work Monday was mixed.</p><p>It was nice that we had a day off, but bad that we lost a day for all the things we usually have to do on Mondays, Staff Sgt. Shawn Farrow of the Warrior Transition Unit said Tuesday. It was a good thing that no one came to work, though, because it ensured water conservation on the whole post. It was the right decision. It would have been too hectic if they had everyone come to work.</p><p>None of my Soldiers could come to work, so we lost a day of work and progress, Staff. Sgt. Scott McMahon, 69th Air Defense Artillery Brigade said Tuesday. We have to play a lot of catch up now because of an entire day gone.</p><p>Even as most Soldiers were told to stay home, some came in to help deliver water trailers containing potable water to their sponsored Fort Hood housing areas Monday. The units filled their water buffaloes with potable water at North Fort Hood, which was unaffected by the water flow interruption.</p><p>Following closures on Monday, Fort Hood Child Development Centers re-opened at their normal times Tuesday to receive children. Additionally, physical fitness centers re-opened their doors at 9 a.m., Tuesday.</p><p>While Carl R. Darnall Army Medical Center outpatient services and some surgical procedures were postponed Monday, the hospital and its outlying clinics resumed normal hours and staffing Tuesday. Through Tuesday, in light of the continued conservation status, surgeries continued to be handled on a case-by-case basis. Patients who had scheduled surgical procedures received instructions directly from their care team.</p><p>Besides Fort Hood, the communities of Killeen, Harker Heights and Copperas Cove were affected by the main water pipeline break.</p>

                    window.location = $('#block-423665 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-423665 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-423665 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-423665 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-423665 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-423665 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
